newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end sharply higher despite yen's rise.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end sharply higher despite yen's rise.

text.p: Tokyo stocks closed sharply higher on Monday, as the key market index recaptured the key 20,000 level on the dollar's partial recovery from a near four-month low against the yen.
The Nikkei 225 average gained 340.73 points or 1.72 percent to 20,143.51. It had hit a morning low of 19,560.06. Its June futures gained 360 points to 20,190.

Brokers said the market was supported by unexpected strength in export-oriented shares and fresh buying in issues which would benefit from lower import costs as a result of the stronger yen, brokers said.
